metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the Jingyangling station from January 1 to December 31, 2018. The site (101.116° E, 37.838° N) was located on a cold meadow surface in the Jingyangling, Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3750 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity (5 m, north), wind speed and direction (10 m, north), air pressure (in the tamper box on the ground), rain gauge (10 m), four-component radiometer (6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m), and soil moisture profile (-0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m; RH_5 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, and Ts_160 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, and Ms_160 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. Due to the snow cover the solar panel causing insufficient power supply, data during December 13-21 were missing; due to the sensor malfunction, there were some NAN invalid values during May 29 to June 22 and July 16 to August 19 of the wind speed and direction; incorrect data of longwave radiation during December 13 to 31; incorrect data of 4 cm depth soil moisture during January 1 to 3 and April 1 to May 20; (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2018-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2018年1月1日至2018年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网上游景阳岭站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县景阳岭垭口，下垫面是高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是101.1160E, 37.8384N，海拔3750m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于雪覆盖太阳能板引起供电不足，导致12.13-12.21间数据缺失；由于传感器问题，5.29-6.22，7.16-8.19风速风向出现较多NAN无效值，12.13-12.31四分量长波辐射数据出错，1.1-1.3，4.1-5.20间4cm土壤水分数据出错。（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2018-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，涡度协方差（EC）测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这一温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的现象。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体表现为E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为在灌溉农田中，当平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文学研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，从而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文学研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂雪）现象。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几大严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和飘雪（漂移雪通量，由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）从2014年1月1日到2017年12月31日以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络的角度研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，采用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还从冻土观测超级站获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据，以捕捉冻融过程。这些更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景（如冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学）的科学家发布，预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（飘雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，期间由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障，数据 intermittently 丢失。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

background: Accurate monitoring of surface fluxes over land surfaces is necessary for global climate change research, ecological environment management, and agricultural and water resource planning. The magnitude of the surface flux is largely determined by vegetation parameters, soil moisture and other states of the land surface. The major methods used for estimating surface fluxes are field measurement, remote-sensing-based methods, and land surface modeling. The variability in field measurements of surface flux has been documented over diurnal, seasonal, and inter-annual time scales.

Land surface models have been rapidly developed to predict surface fluxes on continuous spatial and temporal scales with physical constraints. Regardless of their specific model structures, all land surface models require observational data to calibrate their parameters and adjust their states. New techniques such as data assimilation are needed to integrate either field or remotely sensed observations with the models, thus improving model accuracy by correcting the model state variables and parameters. Data assimilation has played an increasingly important role in improving predictions of such land surface state variables as the leaf area index, soil temperature profile, soil moisture profile, and other related variables, e.g., surface fluxes.

Spatially distributed estimates of surface flux can be obtained from remote-sensing-based methods. The surface fluxes also can be obtained based on variational techniques and relatively simple models with the assimilation of field-measured land surface temperatures. In a land surface model, the sensible and latent heat fluxes are diagnostic variables, and they are affected by many factors (e.g., model states and parameters). As a new-generation Chinese polar orbiting meteorological satellite, the FY-3 series consists of two experimental (FY-3A/B) and at least four operational satellites (FY-3C/D/E/F). The FY-3 series is expected to have a service life that lasts until 2020. The FY-3A was launched in the year 2008. Visible and infrared radiometer (VIRR) is one of the 11 sensors mounted on the FY-3A satellite and has a nominal spatial resolution of approximately 1 km×1 km at the nadir. The common land model (CoLM) is a state-of-the-art model developed by many groups and validated with extensive field data sites. In CoLM, soil moisture is important for dividing the net radiation into the ground heat, sensible, and latent heat fluxes.

Inaccurate surface flux predictions are highly correlated with errors in land surface temperature estimates. Generally, the diurnal variation trends of the land surface temperature and surface flux can be predicted correctly using the CoLM. The daily averaged evaporation fraction (EF, ratio between latent heat flux and available energy) can be used to describe the splitting of available energy into sensible and latent heat fluxes. The LAS instrument can measure the sensible heat flux at a larger scale than the EC system.
research objective: In this work, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme is developed to improve predictions of surface flux.

The current study constructed a dual-pass data assimilation scheme with an ensemble Kalman filter (EnKF) to improve the surface flux predictions with assimilation of remotely sensed land surface temperature. This study carried out the first experiment to assimilate remotely sensed land surface temperatures (LST) derived from FY3A-VIRR into a land surface model.

In this study, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme was constructed to estimate the surface fluxes via the independent optimization of the soil moisture and vegetation parameters. The aim of this study was to eliminate or reduce the errors between the model simulation and observation.
challenges: Methods are difficult to use for continuous monitoring of surface fluxes because the data derived from satellites are instantaneous and often contaminated by the presence of clouds.

However, these measurements are difficult to use for monitoring surface fluxes at the regional scale because they only produce either point or patch-scale data. The deviations between the FY3A-VIRR LST data and the ground measurements are determined by many factors. The terrain effect can affect the accuracy of the FY3A-VIRR LST retrievals. The mismatch of the spatial and temporal scales between the FY3A-VIRR and field-measured LST can also cause these biases.

The differences between the sensible heat fluxes measured by the EC and LAS system are primarily caused by the energy imbalance of the EC, the heterogeneity of the underlying surfaces, and the differences between the source areas of the EC and LAS measurements. Because of the short memory of the land surface temperature, it is difficult to assimilate the land surface temperatures. Directly assimilating land surface temperature to optimize soil moisture may cause model simulations that are more unstable.
methods: In this work, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme is developed to improve predictions of surface flux. Pass 1 of the dual-pass data assimilation scheme optimizes the model vegetation parameters at the weekly temporal scale, and Pass 2 optimizes the soil moisture at the daily temporal scale. Based on ensemble Kalman filter (EnKF), the land surface temperature (LST) data derived from the new generation of Chinese meteorology satellite (FY3A-VIRR) are assimilated into common land model (CoLM) for the first time. Six sites, Daman, Guantao, Arou, BJ, Miyun and Jiyuan, are selected for the data assimilation experiments and include different climatological conditions.

The dual-pass data assimilation technique employed in this study optimizes the model states and parameters independently. The two passes of the scheme assimilate the remotely sensed land surface temperatures (LST) derived from the FY3A satellite. With the assimilation of the FY3A-VIRR LST data, Pass 1 is used to optimize the model parameters at the weekly temporal scale, and Pass 2 is used to optimize the soil moisture at the daily temporal scale. Six Chinese flux observation sites with different land cover types (alpine meadow, grassland, cropland, and orchard) were selected to conduct the data assimilation experiments. The FY3A-VIRR LST data are compared with the ground measurements.

In this study, the MODIS LAI products are incorporated directly into the model, and the vegetation parameters are optimized at the weekly temporal scale with Pass 1 of the dual-pass data assimilation scheme. At the daily temporal scale, the soil moisture is optimized with Pass 2 of the dual-pass data assimilation scheme. The land surface temperature data from the new generation Chinese meteorology satellite FY3A-VIRR were assimilated into CoLM for the first time based on the EnKF algorithm. The source areas of the LAS measurements were calculated using a footprint model and overlaid with a FY3A-VIRR pixel.
dataset: The land surface temperature (LST) data derived from the new generation of Chinese meteorology satellite (FY3A-VIRR) are assimilated into common land model (CoLM) for the first time. Six sites, Daman, Guantao, Arou, BJ, Miyun and Jiyuan, are selected for the data assimilation experiments and include different climatological conditions. The results are compared with those from a dataset generated by a multi-scale surface flux observation system that includes an automatic weather station (AWS), eddy covariance (EC) and large aperture scintillometer (LAS).

The FY-3A land surface temperature data will become the new data source for global water and energy balance research. The FY3A-VIRR LST products can provide the LST and emissivity of each pixel, and the data are stored in a hierarchical data format (HDF), which is a sinusoidal projection with a spatial resolution of 1 km. Data from six sites located in three major nature zones (western arid and semi-arid area, eastern monsoon area, and Qinghai-Tibet alpine meadow) of People’s Republic of China (PRC) are used for the data assimilation experiments.
findings: The results indicate that the dual-pass data assimilation scheme is able to reduce model uncertainties and improve predictions of surface flux with the assimilation of FY3A-VIRR LST data.

The dual-pass data assimilation scheme reduced the model uncertainties and improved the prediction abilities of the model. The average BIAS values of the six sites changed from 28.7 to 5.3 W m 2 and from 16.9 to 16.1 W m2; the average RMSE values dropped from 71.7 to 46.8 W m 2 and from 93.7 to 70.8 W m 2; and the average R-values increased from 0.75 to 0.78 and from 0.66 to 0.82, respectively. The average BIAS values of the assimilation EF results dropped from 0.21 to 0.01, the average RMSE values dropped from 0.31 to 0.15, and the average R-values increased from 0.43 to 0.73. The comparisons showed that the assimilation results match well against the LAS measurements, and the correlations between the assimilation results and LAS measurements were higher than that of the model simulations at the Daman, Guantao, Arou, BJ, and Jiyuan sites.
backgroundCn: 对陆地表面通量的准确监测对于全球气候变化研究、生态环境管理以及农业和水资源规划是必要的。表面通量的大小在很大程度上由植被参数、土壤湿度和其他地表状态决定。估算表面通量的主要方法包括现场测量、基于遥感的方法和陆面模型。现场测量的表面通量在日变化、季节变化和年际变化时间尺度上存在变异性。
陆面模型的快速发展使其能够在连续的空间和时间尺度上预测表面通量，并具备物理约束。无论其具体模型结构如何，所有陆面模型都需要观测数据来校准其参数和调整其状态。新技术如数据同化被需要用来将现场或遥感观测与模型整合，从而通过修正模型状态变量和参数来提高模型的准确性。数据同化在改善陆面状态变量的预测方面发挥了越来越重要的作用，例如叶面积指数、土壤温度剖面、土壤湿度剖面以及其他相关变量，如表面通量。

空间分布的表面通量估计可以通过基于遥感的方法获得。表面通量也可以基于变分技术和相对简单的模型，通过同化实地测量的地表温度来获得。在陆面模型中，显热和潜热通量是诊断变量，受许多因素（例如模型状态和参数）的影响。作为新一代中国极轨气象卫星，FY-3系列包括两颗实验卫星（FY-3A/B）和至少四颗运营卫星（FY-3C/D/E/F）。FY-3系列预计服务寿命将持续到2020年。FY-3A于2008年发射。可见光和红外辐射仪（VIRR）是FY-3A卫星上安装的11个传感器之一，具有约1 km×1 km的名义空间分辨率（在天顶方向）。共同陆面模型（CoLM）是由多个团队开发的先进模型，并经过广泛的实地数据站验证。在CoLM中，土壤湿度对于将净辐射分配到地面热、显热和潜热通量中非常重要。
不准确的表面通量预测与地表温度估计的误差高度相关。一般来说，CoLM能够正确预测地表温度和表面通量的日变化趋势。日均蒸发分数（EF，即潜热通量与可用能量的比率）可以用来描述可用能量在显热通量和潜热通量之间的分配。LAS仪器能够在比EC系统更大规模上测量显热通量。
research objectiveCn: 在这项工作中，开发了一种双重通道数据同化方案，以改善对表面通量的预测。
本研究构建了一种双重数据同化方案，采用集合卡尔曼滤波器（EnKF）来改善表面通量预测，通过同化遥感地表温度。该研究首次进行实验，将来自FY3A-VIRR的遥感地表温度（LST）同化到陆面模型中。
在本研究中，构建了一种双重数据同化方案，通过独立优化土壤湿度和植被参数来估计表面通量。本研究的目的是消除或减少模型模拟与观测之间的误差。
challengesCn: 由于卫星获取的数据是瞬时的，并且常常受到云层的干扰，因此使用方法对表面通量进行连续监测是困难的。
然而，这些测量在区域尺度上监测表面通量时很难使用，因为它们只能产生点或斑块尺度的数据。FY3A-VIRR LST 数据与地面测量之间的偏差受到许多因素的影响。地形效应可能会影响 FY3A-VIRR LST 检索的准确性。FY3A-VIRR 和现场测量的 LST 之间的空间和时间尺度不匹配也可能导致这些偏差。
通过EC和LAS系统测量的显热通量之间的差异主要是由于EC的能量不平衡、底层表面的异质性以及EC和LAS测量的源区之间的差异。由于地表温度的短期记忆，直接同化地表温度以优化土壤湿度可能会导致模型模拟的不稳定性。
methodsCn: 在这项工作中，开发了一种双重通道数据同化方案，以改善表面通量的预测。双重通道数据同化方案的第一通道在周尺度上优化模型植被参数，第二通道在日尺度上优化土壤湿度。基于集成卡尔曼滤波器（EnKF），首次将来自新一代中国气象卫星（FY3A-VIRR）的陆面温度（LST）数据同化到常见陆面模型（CoLM）中。选择了六个站点，分别是大满、馆陶、阿柔、北京、密云和济源，进行数据同化实验，这些站点具有不同的气候条件。
本研究采用的双重数据同化技术独立优化模型状态和参数。该方案的两个阶段同化来自FY3A卫星的遥感地表温度（LST）。在同化FY3A-VIRR LST数据的过程中，第一阶段用于在周时间尺度上优化模型参数，第二阶段用于在日时间尺度上优化土壤湿度。选择了六个不同土地覆盖类型的中国通量观测站（高山草甸、草地、农田和果园）进行数据同化实验。FY3A-VIRR LST数据与地面测量结果进行了比较。
在本研究中，MODIS LAI 产品被直接纳入模型中，植被参数在每周时间尺度上通过双重数据同化方案的第一遍进行优化。在每日时间尺度上，土壤湿度通过双重数据同化方案的第二遍进行优化。基于EnKF算法，来自新一代中国气象卫星FY3A-VIRR的地表温度数据首次被同化到CoLM中。LAS测量的源区通过足迹模型计算，并与FY3A-VIRR像素叠加。
datasetCn: 来自新一代中国气象卫星（FY3A-VIRR）的地表温度（LST）数据首次被同化到通用陆地模型（CoLM）中。选择了六个站点，分别是大闸、广陶、阿柔、北京、密云和济源，进行数据同化实验，这些站点涵盖了不同的气候条件。结果与由多尺度表面通量观测系统生成的数据集进行比较，该系统包括自动气象站（AWS）、涡度协方差（EC）和大孔径闪烁仪（LAS）。
FY-3A陆地表面温度数据将成为全球水分和能量平衡研究的新数据源。FY3A-VIRR LST产品可以提供每个像素的陆地表面温度和发射率，数据以层次数据格式（HDF）存储，采用正弦投影，空间分辨率为1公里。来自中国三个主要自然区域（西部干旱和半干旱地区、东部季风区和青藏高原 alpine meadow）的六个站点的数据用于数据同化实验。
findingsCn: 结果表明，双通道数据同化方案能够通过同化FY3A-VIRR地表温度数据来减少模型不确定性，并改善地表通量的预测。

双重数据同化方案减少了模型的不确定性，提高了模型的预测能力。六个站点的平均偏差（BIAS）值从28.7 W m 2 变为5.3 W m 2， 从16.9 W m 2 变为16.1 W m 2；平均均方根误差（RMSE）值从71.7 W m 2 降至46.8 W m 2，从93.7 W m 2 降至70.8 W m 2；平均相关系数（R值）从0.75 增加到0.78，从0.66 增加到0.82。 同化的蒸散发（EF）结果的平均偏差值从0.21 降至0.01，平均均方根误差值从0.31 降至0.15，平均相关系数从0.43 增加到0.73。比较结果表明，同化结果与激光雷达（LAS）测量值匹配良好，并且同化结果与LAS测量值之间的相关性高于模型模拟在大门、馆陶、阿柔、北京和济源站点的相关性。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to monitor snow cover properties in an alpine region?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于监测高山地区雪盖特性的资料收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method used to monitor snow cover properties in an alpine region is the use of a snow observation superstation, which employs state-of-the-art techniques and instruments to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes. This includes automated measurements of snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) using instruments like GammaMONitor, and blowing snow flux using devices like FlowCapt.
Example.AnswerCn: 监测高山地区雪盖特性的一个数据收集方法是使用雪观测超级站，该站采用先进的技术和仪器来捕捉雪的积累和融化过程。这包括使用GammaMONitor等仪器自动测量雪深和雪水当量（SWE），以及使用FlowCapt等设备测量吹雪通量。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that integrates multi-scale observation data for hydrological research in mountainous regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个整合多尺度观测数据的示例数据集，用于山区的水文研究？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is the comprehensive suite of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data collected from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China. This dataset includes observations from automatic meteorological stations, snow observation superstations, and frozen ground observation superstations to support alpine region hydrological model development.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是来自中国黑河流域上游的一个综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络收集的长期水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据。该数据集包括来自自动气象站、雪观测超级站和冻土观测超级站的观测数据，以支持高山地区水文模型的开发。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you give an example of how remote sensing data is used to improve predictions of surface fluxes in land surface models?
Example.QuestionCn: 你能举一个例子说明遥感数据如何用于改善陆面模型中表面通量的预测吗？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of using remote sensing data to improve predictions of surface fluxes involves assimilating land surface temperature (LST) data derived from the FY3A-VIRR satellite into a common land model (CoLM). This approach uses a dual-pass data assimilation scheme with an ensemble Kalman filter to optimize soil moisture and vegetation parameters independently, thereby enhancing the accuracy of surface flux predictions.
Example.AnswerCn: 使用遥感数据改善地表通量预测的一个例子是将来自FY3A-VIRR卫星的陆地表面温度（LST）数据同化到一个通用陆面模型（CoLM）中。这种方法采用双重数据同化方案，利用集合卡尔曼滤波器独立优化土壤湿度和植被参数，从而提高地表通量预测的准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in collecting remote sensing data for hydrological modeling in alpine regions compared to heterogeneous agricultural landscapes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集遥感数据用于水文模型相比于异质农业景观面临的挑战有哪些？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In alpine regions, challenges include harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topography, which hinder consistent data collection and present technological barriers. In heterogeneous agricultural landscapes, challenges arise from the need for high-resolution thermal imaging to accurately separate soil and vegetation temperatures, and the strong advective environments affecting model performance.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，挑战包括恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集，并带来了技术障碍。在异质农业景观中，挑战来自于需要高分辨率的热成像以准确区分土壤和植被温度，以及强烈的平流环境对模型性能的影响。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do datasets for evaluating evapotranspiration models differ between artificial oasis areas and alpine regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 评估蒸散发模型的数据集在人工绿洲地区和高山地区之间有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Datasets for artificial oasis areas focus on high-resolution thermal images and eddy covariance measurements to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration. Alpine region datasets emphasize long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data from distributed networks to support hydrological modeling and ecosystem function analysis.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 人工绿洲区域的数据集侧重于高分辨率热成像和涡度协方差测量，以将蒸散发分为蒸发和植物蒸腾。阿尔卑斯地区的数据集强调来自分布式网络的长期水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，以支持水文模型和生态系统功能分析。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can data collection methods be adapted to overcome the challenges of harsh climates and complex topography in alpine regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何调整数据收集方法，以克服高山地区恶劣气候和复杂地形带来的挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In alpine regions, data collection methods can be adapted by establishing integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological observation networks with automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground. These networks are designed to capture detailed spatially distributed meteorological variables and processes such as snow accumulation and ablation, and freeze-thaw cycles, which are crucial for understanding hydrological processes in challenging environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，可以通过建立集成的、分布式的和多尺度的水文气象观测网络，结合自动气象站和雪冻土超级站，来调整数据收集方法。这些网络旨在捕捉详细的空间分布气象变量和过程，如雪的积累和融化，以及冻融循环，这对于理解复杂环境中的水文过程至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What strategies can be employed to ensure the accuracy and consistency of datasets in regions where observational data is scarce?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在观测数据稀缺的地区，可以采用哪些策略来确保数据集的准确性和一致性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: To ensure accuracy and consistency of datasets in regions with scarce observational data, the integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations through data assimilation techniques can be employed. Additionally, establishing comprehensive observation networks that include automated weather stations and advanced sensors for snow and soil properties can help fill gaps and provide reliable datasets for modeling and validation purposes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 为了确保在观测数据稀缺地区数据集的准确性和一致性，可以通过数据同化技术将遥感数据与地面观测数据相结合。此外，建立包括自动气象站和先进传感器（用于雪和土壤特性）的综合观测网络，可以帮助填补数据空白，并为建模和验证提供可靠的数据集。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can the integration of remote sensing data and field measurements enhance the predictive capabilities of hydrological models in alpine regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 遥感数据和现场测量的整合可以通过哪些方式增强高山地区水文模型的预测能力？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data and field measurements can enhance the predictive capabilities of hydrological models by providing comprehensive datasets that improve the parameterization and validation of models. This integration allows for the correction of model state variables and parameters through data assimilation, leading to improved predictions of surface fluxes, soil moisture, and vegetation parameters, ultimately enhancing the understanding of complex hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与实地测量的结合可以通过提供全面的数据集来增强水文模型的预测能力，从而改善模型的参数化和验证。这种整合允许通过数据同化来修正模型状态变量和参数，从而提高对地表通量、土壤湿度和植被参数的预测，最终增强对高山地区复杂水文过程的理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in collecting consistent data in alpine regions for hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集一致数据以进行水文建模的挑战原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the main factors leading to data scarcity in alpine regions, affecting hydrological process modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致高山地区数据稀缺的主要因素有哪些，这些因素影响水文过程建模？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in the alpine region is due to difficulties of access and technological barriers, which have hindered alpine hydrological modeling and motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难和技术障碍，这阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型的建立，并促使下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do errors occur in the surface flux prediction using land surface models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在使用陆面模型进行表面通量预测时会出现错误？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inaccurate surface flux predictions are highly correlated with errors in land surface temperature estimates. Terrain effects can affect the accuracy of land surface temperature retrievals, and the mismatch of spatial and temporal scales between satellite-derived and ground-measured data can also cause these biases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 不准确的表面通量预测与地表温度估计的误差高度相关。地形效应可能影响地表温度的检索精度，而卫星获取的数据与地面测量数据之间的空间和时间尺度不匹配也可能导致这些偏差。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using high-resolution thermal cameras in the estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures for evapotranspiration models?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪估算土壤和冠层组分温度对蒸散发模型的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-resolution thermal cameras allows for improved estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which enhances the validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration measurements when combined with stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems. These refined estimates support more accurate separations of latent heat flux components, leading to better model performance even in challenging environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪可以更准确地估计土壤和冠层成分的温度，这在结合稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统时，有助于提高蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发测量的验证。这些精确的估计支持对潜热通量成分的更准确分离，从而在困难环境中提高模型性能。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary goal of integrating ground-based measurements with remote sensing data in alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中，整合地面测量与遥感数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goal is to improve the prediction of hydrological processes by combining ground-based measurements with remote sensing data to validate and calibrate models, thereby enhancing the understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是通过结合地面测量与遥感数据来提高水文过程的预测，以验证和校准模型，从而增强对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the objective of establishing an integrated observation network for capturing snow and frozen ground data in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立一个综合观测网络以捕捉高山地区的雪和冻土数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to address scientific questions related to providing accurate forcing data for hydrological models, integrating observations and simulations for better understanding, and understanding how climate change and human activities alter fundamental hydrological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是解决与为水文模型提供准确强迫数据相关的科学问题，整合观测和模拟以更好地理解，并了解气候变化和人类活动如何改变基本水文过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key procedural steps involved in establishing a comprehensive observation network for capturing meteorological and hydrological data in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区建立全面的气象和水文数据观测网络涉及哪些关键程序步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological observation network is established with automatic meteorological stations and superstations. These include monitoring meteorological variables such as wind, temperature, humidity, and radiation at specific heights, capturing snow accumulation and ablation processes, and measuring soil temperature and moisture through wireless sensor networks and other advanced techniques.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 建立了一个集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象观测网络，配备自动气象站和超级站。这些站点监测特定高度的气象变量，如风速、温度、湿度和辐射，捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，并通过无线传感器网络和其他先进技术测量土壤温度和湿度。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are used to separately measure and validate evapotranspiration components such as evaporation and transpiration in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于分别测量和验证异质土地表面蒸散发组成部分（如蒸发和蒸腾）的 methodologies 有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Field observations are conducted using high-resolution thermal cameras and eddy covariance systems to measure soil and canopy temperatures and turbulent fluxes. The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is applied, using these measurements to partition and validate evapotranspiration components. The model is refined and validated using combinations of stable isotope techniques and ground-based measurements to accurately estimate and separate evaporation and transpiration.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 现场观测使用高分辨率热像仪和涡度协方差系统来测量土壤和树冠温度以及湍流通量。应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，利用这些测量结果对蒸散发成分进行分配和验证。该模型通过稳定同位素技术和地面测量的组合进行优化和验证，以准确估计和分离蒸发和蒸腾。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods are employed to ensure accurate measurement of meteorological and hydrological variables in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，为确保气象和水文变量的准确测量，采用了哪些数据收集方法？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data are monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs), along with snow and frozen ground observations collected from superstations using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets are also obtained to capture freeze-thaw processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过一个观察网络进行监测，该网络连接了一组自动气象站（AMSs），同时还收集了来自超级站的雪和冻土观测，这些观测采用了先进的技术和仪器。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也被获取，以捕捉冻融过程。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in collecting consistent and complete data in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集一致和完整数据可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed. These conditions hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models, and the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions due to difficulties of access and technological barriers further complicates the collection of consistent data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行完整和一致的数据收集。这些条件妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展，而由于获取困难和技术障碍，高山地区观测数据的稀缺进一步复杂化了一致数据的收集。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expectations of using a dual-pass data assimilation scheme in improving surface flux predictions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用双重数据同化方案来改善表面通量预测的期望是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The dual-pass data assimilation scheme is expected to reduce model uncertainties and improve predictions of surface flux. By independently optimizing the soil moisture and vegetation parameters, the scheme aims to eliminate or reduce errors between model simulations and observations, ultimately improving the prediction abilities of the model.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 双重通道数据同化方案预计将减少模型不确定性，并改善地表通量的预测。通过独立优化土壤湿度和植被参数，该方案旨在消除或减少模型模拟与观测之间的误差，最终提高模型的预测能力。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might remote sensing data require calibration and validation in alpine hydrology research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 遥感数据在高山水文学研究中可能需要校准和验证的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions, involve various sources of uncertainties due to the complexities of the earth system. To improve the prediction of hydrological processes, these data must be validated and calibrated. This process is crucial to address the knowledge gap in alpine region hydrology research and ensure that the data accurately reflect the actual environmental conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据，尤其是在高山地区，由于地球系统的复杂性，涉及各种不确定性。为了改善水文过程的预测，这些数据必须经过验证和校准。这个过程对于填补高山地区水文学研究中的知识空白至关重要，并确保数据准确反映实际环境条件。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are current data collection methods in capturing the complexities of alpine hydrological processes, particularly in challenging environments like the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉高山水文过程的复杂性方面的有效性如何，特别是在像黑河上游这样的挑战性环境中？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current data collection methods, such as those implemented in the integrated hydrometeorological network in the Heihe River Basin, are quite comprehensive, employing automatic meteorological stations and superstations to capture diverse variables like snow cover and frozen ground properties. However, challenges remain due to the cold, harsh climate, and complex topography, which can inhibit consistent data collection and hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，例如在黑河流域实施的综合水文气象网络，十分全面，采用自动气象站和超级气象站来捕捉雪盖和冻土特性等多种变量。然而，由于寒冷恶劣的气候和复杂的地形，仍然存在挑战，这可能会影响数据收集的一致性，并阻碍遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How can the integration of remote sensing data improve the accuracy of surface flux predictions in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 遥感数据的整合如何提高异质景观中表面通量预测的准确性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integration of remote sensing data, like those from the FY3A-VIRR satellite, into land surface models can significantly improve the accuracy of surface flux predictions. By assimilating land surface temperatures, a dual-pass data assimilation scheme can optimize vegetation parameters and soil moisture, reducing model uncertainties and improving predictions. Nevertheless, challenges such as cloud contamination and terrain effects need to be addressed for optimal integration.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据（如FY3A-VIRR卫星的数据）整合到陆面模型中，可以显著提高地表通量预测的准确性。通过同化地表温度，双重数据同化方案可以优化植被参数和土壤湿度，减少模型不确定性并改善预测。然而，云污染和地形效应等挑战需要解决，以实现最佳整合。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can effectively address the challenges posed by the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何有效应对高山地区寒冷恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂地形带来的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection methods in alpine regions involve establishing integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks. This includes automatic meteorological stations and superstations that monitor snow cover and frozen ground using advanced instruments like thermal infrared cameras, ultrasonic sensors for snow depth, and gamma monitors for snow water equivalent. These methods are designed to capture detailed meteorological, hydrological, and soil physics data while overcoming environmental challenges by using robust and state-of-the-art measurement technologies.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集方法涉及建立综合、分布式和多尺度的观测网络。这包括自动气象站和超级气象站，使用先进仪器如热红外相机、超声波传感器（用于雪深测量）和伽马监测仪（用于雪水当量）监测雪盖和冻土。这些方法旨在捕捉详细的气象、水文和土壤物理数据，同时通过使用坚固和先进的测量技术克服环境挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how datasets can be used to improve predictions of surface flux in heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定数据集如何用于改善异质景观中表面通量的预测。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets collected from field measurements, remote sensing, and land surface modeling provide crucial inputs for improving predictions of surface fluxes. Techniques like data assimilation, specifically the dual-pass data assimilation scheme with ensemble Kalman filter, integrate remotely sensed land surface temperature data into models like the common land model (CoLM). This approach optimizes vegetation parameters and soil moisture, enhancing model accuracy in predicting surface fluxes across diverse landscapes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 从实地测量、遥感和陆面建模收集的数据集为改善表面通量的预测提供了重要输入。数据同化技术，特别是采用集合卡尔曼滤波器的双重数据同化方案，将遥感的陆面温度数据整合到像常见陆面模型（CoLM）这样的模型中。该方法优化了植被参数和土壤湿度，提高了模型在不同景观中预测表面通量的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m not clear on how data assimilation techniques handle uncertainties in land surface temperature estimates for accurate surface flux predictions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不清楚数据同化技术如何处理地表温度估计中的不确定性，以便准确预测地表通量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data assimilation techniques, such as the dual-pass data assimilation scheme, address uncertainties in land surface temperature estimates by independently optimizing model states and parameters. The assimilation of remotely sensed land surface temperatures derived from satellites helps refine model inputs, reduce biases, and improve predictive accuracy of surface fluxes. The scheme utilizes ensemble Kalman filter methods to adjust vegetation parameters weekly and soil moisture daily, thereby minimizing errors and enhancing flux predictions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据同化技术，如双重数据同化方案，通过独立优化模型状态和参数来解决地表温度估计中的不确定性。通过同化来自卫星的遥感地表温度，可以帮助优化模型输入，减少偏差，提高地表通量的预测准确性。该方案利用集合卡尔曼滤波方法，每周调整植被参数，每天调整土壤湿度，从而最小化误差，增强通量预测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges and opportunities associated with the integration of remote sensing data and ground-based measurements for improving hydrological modeling in alpine regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析遥感数据与地面测量数据结合在改善高山地区水文模型中的挑战与机遇。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include the scarcity of observation data due to difficult access and technological barriers, and the need to validate and calibrate remote sensing data due to uncertainties. Opportunities arise from the potential of remote sensing data combined with data assimilation to improve hydrological process predictions by providing accurate forcing data, validating remote sensing products, and evaluating distributed models.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括由于难以获取和技术障碍导致观测数据稀缺，以及由于不确定性需要验证和校准遥感数据。机遇来自于遥感数据与数据同化相结合的潜力，通过提供准确的强迫数据、验证遥感产品和评估分布式模型来改善水文过程预测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the methods employed in capturing snow cover properties and their impact on hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在捕捉雪盖特性方面采用的方法及其对高山地区水文过程的影响。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Methods include using a snow observation superstation with state-of-the-art techniques to measure snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE), and blowing snow. These measurements are crucial for understanding snow accumulation and ablation processes, which significantly impact hydrological processes and eco-functions in alpine regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 方法包括使用雪观测超级站，采用先进技术测量雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪。这些测量对于理解雪的积累和融化过程至关重要，这些过程对高山地区的水文过程和生态功能有显著影响。
